I think that this bishop move against the French is always bad.  It gives black just a slight advantage.

Sometimes here I would play either Nge7 or Bd7.  However, the best move is ...
moves.5... Qb6:
Qa5 is slightly better.
5... Qa5 6. Bxc6+ bxc6 7. dxc5 Qxc5 (7... Bxc5 8. b4 ) 8. Be3 Qb5 9. Qe2 Qxe2+ 10. Nxe2 f6 11. exf6 Nxf6 12. Nd2 e5 13. h3 Bd6 14. f4 Ba6
moves.14. h3 Rc8 15. Rb1 Bb4 16. Re1 O-O: Now Re3 removes an annoying pin.
moves.17. Qe2 Qa5 18. Bc1 b5: Now Qd1 preparing Re3 would help white defend.
moves.19. axb5 Ne7: Now if 20. bxa6 Bb5 21. Qd1 (21. Qe3?! Nf5  22. Qf4 Bd3) Bd3 leaves the rook nowhere to hide.  22. Rb2 Qxa6 (Bc3 right away allows b4, which is trickier.)  23. Kh2 Bc3
moves.20... Bxb5 21. Qe1 Rc2 22. Kh2: 22. Rb2 Rc7 23. Kh2 Rfc8 24. Qh1 Bd3 [To prepare Qa1.] 25. Nc4 (25. Nb1 Qa1 26. Bd2 Qxb2 (26... Ba3 27. Nxa3 Qxb2 28. Ra1 Be4 29. Be3 Nf5 30. Qe1 Nxe3)) 25... dxc4 26. bxc4 Bxc4
